refnamediv.refpurpose: Manual page for RTS2 Sitech controller on German Equatorial Mount.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page describes driver for German Equatorial Mount (GEM) commanded by Sidereal Technology motor controller. For manual page describing generic telescope driver, please see rts2-teld7 manual page.

refsect1.title: Sitech variables
refsect1.para: Mount interface provides common variables, visible in rts2-mon1 and rts2-xmlrpcclient1. They govern focuser behaviour and show its state. They are described below.

refsect1.title: Setting up limits and count values
refsect1.para: When telescope parameters need to be set into driver init file, please follow this checklist:

listitem.para: Put telescope into parking position. Parking position is usually on one side of the pier, telescope looking to zenith (altitude = 90 degrees, zenith distance = 0 degrees).
Power off the Sidereal electronic box.
Power on the Sidereal electronic box.

It is important you start with freshly powered electronic, with telescope in parking position. If you do not start with powered up electronic with telescope in parking position, chances are that you will have RA or DEC axis turned full turn from "0" position (when axis value is between 0 and counts per full turn).
Move telescope in RA axis to a limit (physical, )
